Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports

Voc√™ ir√° juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 pa√≠ses, trabalhando com paix√£o para oferecer √≥timas experi√™ncias aos clientes e servi√ßos de alta qualidade. Promovemos a colabora√ß√£o e transpar√™ncia e esfor√ßamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX Payments, Digital, Client Engagement,

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up)
Build a state of the art industrial "Client Intelligence" solution
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs )


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)


About The Team

The FX Payments activity is a key area of growth for Global Markets. In order to support and accelerate that growth an electronic platform (FX+) has been designed. FX+ is delivering automated FX solutions to support other BNPP business lines such as Cash Management, Trade Finance, Correspondent Banking, who require FX to deliver transactional services to their clients.


FX+ Payments is a platform that manages the execution of FX within International Payments
(i.e. Payment + FX in one transaction).
FX+ is successfully implemented in ca 40 countries across Europe, MEA, APAC and North America ; it is globally generating a very significant stream of revenues for BNP Paribas
FX+ aims to strengthen the BNPP FX electronic offer: Enrich the transaction banking offer (pricing flexibility, extend currency coverage ) with a better FX execution (transparency, automation of processes, 24/7 service, ...)
Within this context, FX+ drives the cross selling with new Business lines (Cash Management, Trade or Supply Chain) and Third parties (Retailers, Payment Service Providers) through a complete and integrated FX+ Product suite, involving innovative Open Banking API solutions.
The FX+ Platform development and the FX Payments marketing are part of the Global Markets eCommerce & Digital (eC&D) team, which is globally responsible for driving the digital strategy and associated transformation across the Global Markets business lines.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in

Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 300 talented people and more than 35

different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to

explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance,

General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation,

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Associate Field Excellence

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Associate Field Excellence will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system.
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Healthcare or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools ( Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Some knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Some knowledge of SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Associate Field Excellence

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Associate Field Excellence, will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system.
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Medium to High knowledge of SQL

Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.

Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Fluency in Italian both written and oral

Title: BDO Static Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The BDO Static Data Analyst‚Äôs mission is to be responsible for the setup and maintenance of client database and ISIN database, in order to allow the integration of order received by the client. It is also a 1st level control for the trades monitoring and correcting any trade with errors

Your Main Activities Are


Ensure Integration and maintenance of clients‚Äô database (either manually or through support to the upload function)
Monitor error queues and trade recycling on a real time basis
Manage the Securities shared database
Mitigate risk exposure through a proper follow-up of procedures and alert/escalation mechanisms
Keep the Team Leader informed about the clients‚Äô activity and escalate issues whenever appropriate
Keep the procedures update
Ensure execution of tasks and complete checklist

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Banking and Financial Operations or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint)
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to share / pass on knowledge
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer Internship
Description:
Keywords: Data Analytics, ETL, Oriented programming, SQL, Tableau, git, python

Your Main Activities Are


Development, maintenance, and support of data processing and analytical stacks
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data
Develop data ETL processes in production environment
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools


Profile And Skills To Success


Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electronic, Biomedical or similar Engineering Master
Knowledge with Python programming language (Java/C++/C# will be considered)
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge and interest in financial markets
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
Effective problem solver and consensus builder
Team work and collaborative mind-set
Fluency in English


About The Team

The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 9 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
  • Knowledge of SQL
  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Knowledge and interest in financial markets
  • Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
  • Effective problem solver and consensus builder
  • Team work and collaborative mind-set
  • Fluency in English

About The Team

The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 9 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst for Fraud
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets, we are leaders and we invest in innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast-growing business.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Credit Process Optimization team has been created in 2018 within Risk Personal Finance Global Credit Decision-making Policies, in Risk corporate teams. During first years, the team has realized numerous optimization projects, both on Fraud & Risk topics, and, capitalizing on them, has developed a first set of analytical modules to speed-up these projects locally.
This position is dedicated to support Germany‚Äôs local risk team by optimizing the fraud decision processes through an analytical approach. Responsibilities include analyzing fraud patterns, developing, and implementing measures to mitigate fraud and coordinating projects with both local and central stakeholders during the implementation of the new IT system. The main activities will be:
Contribute to the identification of optimization levers on risk & fraud decision process
Support the formalization and further development of effective strategies to manage and prevent fraud
Develop and optimize analyses and reports used to support management decisions
Define and modify necessary data sources and reports in collaboration with internal and external providers
Follow Risk & Fraud rules efficiency and find ways of optimizations through analytical methods and using our internal set of modules dedicated to optimization topics (RBO Toolkit)
Measure the added-value of each optimization project by the definition and valuation of key performance indicators
Provide contents for trainings to partners and employees
Maintain and optimize anti-fraud tools. Monitor their performance and prepare proposals to increase their effectiveness and efficiency
Advise internal stakeholders on fraud topics
Support communications departments in the procurement of contents that support internal and external partners in detecting and preventing fraud

The Mission is important, but working environment is also important!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments. You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.


What do we have to offer you?


The team is evolving in a strategic and challenging environment within Personal Finance and has interactions with different central and local directions. Working in an international environment, the Fraud Credit Process Optimization Data analyst develops his/her knowledge on local specificities: products, market, risk, ...


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, ideally in Fraud, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Have you monitored and analysed risk trends and/or fraud trends on applications and/or card payments and detect ways of optimization?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? German is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for ‚Ä¶
We look forward to your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in

Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 300 talented people and more than 35

different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to

explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance,

General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation,

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

SENIOR ASSOCIATE FIELD EXCELLENCE

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Senior Associate Field Excellence will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/She is problem solving and result oriented has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in engineering, mathematics, business, healthcare or data
3+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Solid understanding of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and verbal communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Strong knowledge of SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Solid understanding of IS systems (including provened capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred).
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Turkish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world‚Äôs largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages ‚Äì and we‚Äôre continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

Title: CRM Executive - Budget & Performance
Description:
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 17 markets.

We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents. Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?

Let‚Äôs start with the role

Join Kaizen as a CRM Executive, Budget and Performance and leverage your data analysis expertise to drive impactful customer engagement strategies. In this role, you‚Äôll support senior leaders in optimizing CRM initiatives, tracking campaign performance, and delivering actionable insights to enhance customer acquisition and retention. If you‚Äôre passionate about turning data into results and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this is the perfect opportunity to make a meaningful impact.

As a CRM Executive, Budget and Performance you will:


Take ownership on reporting datasets of all CRM KPIs and promotional campaigns, ensuring alignment with company objectives and delivering actionable insights to empower Senior Management in decision-making and performance optimization.
Partner with Senior Managers and all other relevant CRM stakeholders to uncover customer insights and recommend strategies to boost campaign effectiveness and customer satisfaction.


What you'll bring:


Proficient in analyzing complex datasets using tools like Excel and other analytic platforms to drive data-driven decision-making.
AnvEffective communicator who translates data insights into clear, stakeholder-friendly messages.
Strong organizational skills with a keen eye for detail, capable of managing multiple tasks and ensuring accuracy in reporting.


What Success Looks Like:


Consistently deliver accurate, data-driven reports and collaborate seamlessly with CRM and Commercial teams to ensure up-to-date performance tracking, driving cost-effective CRM actions that prioritize customer satisfaction and align with customer preferences.


Kaizen Gaming Perks

üïë Hybrid way of working

üèÉ A buddy will support you with your onboarding

üí∏ Competitive pay and bonus scheme

üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Private health insurance for you and your family

üí∞ Monthly meal allowance

üöó Commuting allowance

‚≠êDevelopmental 360¬∞ feedback framework

üìö Unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation,or age.

Recruitment Privacy Notice

Regarding the data you share with us, you may find and read our recruitment privacy notice here.

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across five markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our five markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium, Finland and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

  • Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
  • Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
  • Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
  • Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
  • Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
  • Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
  • Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
  • EU work permit is required

Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
‚Ää

Seeking a Data Engineer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?

  • Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you‚Äôll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
  • Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you‚Äôll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
  • Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company‚Äôs culture.
  • Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you‚Äôre being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.

Perks Of Becoming a Rhino

  • You‚Äôll get a welcome kit üìö
  • Opportunities for career progression üìà
  • Live on the edge with our health insurance üè•
  • Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts üì∫ üéµ
  • Coverflex meal card üç≤ üí≥
  • Other protocols and special discounts ‚ú®

For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:

  • 6+ years of proven experience as a Data Engineer or Data Quality Engineer in a fast-paced environment;
  • Expertise in SQL and SQL-like query languages;
  • Deep expertise in Python, with experience in organizing Python-based projects;
  • Extensive experience with Snowflake;
  • Strong experience with ETL and ELT processes;
  • Experience working with AWS Cloud and its services;
  • Proficiency in Data Build Tool (DBT);
  • Strong understanding of various data modeling methodologies (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault);
  • Fluency in English is mandatory;
  • Availability for fully remote work, based in Portugal.

Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
We are based in Estonia and we operate globally. We love to work remotely and travel the world. Having freedom, ownership and passion for recruitment are key for us.

We hire amazing tech talent for great companies

We coach highly motivated Professionals to get better careers

We empower recruiters to hire more and better Talent.

Do you want to help us to grow?

Hiire is helping Siemens Mobility, a global leader in Engineering and Technology, hire a Data Engineer for their team to help them advance on their mission of shaping the future of mobility!

As a world leader in state-of-the-art transportation solutions, Siemens Mobility is at the forefront of digital solutions for the railways sector. By designing, implementing, and maintaining advanced Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solutions, we are helping our Mobility customers transform their business and turn their asset data into valuable information.

About The Role

Join Siemens Mobility Portugal for a dynamic role in our global engineering and technology services team. As a leader in sustainable transportation, we innovate solutions for electrification, automation, and digitization.

Explore Railigent X, a suite empowering rail operators with data comprehension and actionable insights. We excel in urban, interurban, and logistics transport, integrating solutions for efficient passenger and freight transportation.

You can find more details about the project here.

As a Data Engineer, you will be key in focusing on and automating data workflows and cloud infrastructure. You will collaborate closely with Data Scientists and DevOps Engineers to ensure smooth and reliable data operations from ingestion to deployment.

Your primary responsibility will be managing and optimizing data pipelines while maintaining performance and scalability across our cloud-based infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build, maintain, and optimize scalable data pipelines to ensure smooth data flow and integration across systems;
  • Manage and optimize real-time data streaming and processing systems to handle large-scale, low-latency data operations;
  • Create and manage APIs to facilitate integration with data systems, enabling smooth data services for internal stakeholders;
  • Ensure the automation and continuous monitoring of data workflows, implementing performance improvements to enhance system efficiency;
  • Collaborate closely with Data Scientists, and DevOps Engineers to enhance data workflows and optimize processes for operational efficiency;
  • Utilize data visualization techniques to monitor pipeline performance and ensure data processes meet business and operational requirements;

Your Qualifications ‚Äì Must Have

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience in a Data-related role);
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering, DevOps, or a related DataOps role;
  • Practical knowledge of cloud-based data systems and workflow automation;
  • Strong proficiency in Python and SQL for building and optimizing data workflows;
  • Solid experience with Docker for managing and deploying data services;
  • Experience with core AWS services such as S3, Lambda, and RDS for cloud-based data operations;
  • Strong experience with Apache Kafka for real-time streaming and low-latency data processing;
  • Fluent English speaking and writing skills.

Your Qualifications ‚Äì Nice To Have

  • Familiarity with FastAPI, Pydantic, or similar frameworks for building APIs;
  • Hands-on experience with Kafka Connect and KSQLDB for advanced streaming functionality;
  • Knowledge of Kubernetes for orchestrating containerized applications;
  • Familiarity with MLFlow or Kubeflow to support machine learning model deployment and operations;
  • Experience with tools like Great Expectations or dbt for data validation and testing;

What You Can Expect From Us

  • Attractive remuneration package;
  • A hybrid and flexible working model to promote a better work-life balance;
  • 2 volunteering days a year and 4 additional given days to your 22 days of leave;
  • Free Health Insurance and access to our on-site medical center;
  • Possibility to enroll in sports activities, both on-campus or through several discounted partner gyms available;
  • Access to Siemens Learning Platforms that allow for internal online courses, as well as external platforms such as Coursera, Udemy, and LinkedIn Learning;
  • A shuttle bus to commute to the facilities, free on-campus parking equipped with free charging points for your electric vehicle, and special tariffs for train trips with CP;
  • Various discounts via multiple portals and partnered websites.

If you are passionate about shaping the future of the railway industry with innovative solutions and meet the above qualifications, we would love to hear from you.

Apply Now! Join us and become part of a team that drives digital transformation in the railway industry through cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team. If you‚Äôre reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place. What are we looking for? People who love technology and, above all, love to learn. And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority. Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you? Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career.

If you‚Äôre a Data Scientist and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we‚Äôre actively looking for you.

What we‚Äôre looking for: Experience in exploratory data analysis, testing hypotheses, and building predictive models Strong background in probability theory and statistics, data mining, and machine learning Experience in Python and Cloud environment Strong knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL Fluent in spoken and written English

What we offer: Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success Powered by JazzHR
