Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

About Us

HISCOX is an international insurer specialized in the market of luxury goods & property, and high end professional insurance. As experts in risk we give people and businesses the confidence to realise their ambitions. With offices in 9 European countries we have a very international staff and encourage a culture that fosters inclusion and collaboration, offering exciting opportunities for personal and professional growth.

In our Lisbon office we have the privilege of employing approximately 500 exceptional professionals representing 29 diverse nationalities. Despite our central location within the city, we recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. As part of our commitment to our employees‚Äô well-being, we provide a 35-hour workweek along with the option for a hybrid working schedule.

Data Analyst ‚Äì Europe

The Role

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, with a strong technical background in data visualization and reporting, particularly using Power BI. You will play a key role in supporting the organization with accurate and meaningful data analysis to drive informed decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Develop, design, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for various stakeholders.
Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, ensuring its accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting needs and translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Optimize Power BI performance, including dataset preparation and data model improvements.
Create and manage data models, relationships, and calculations within Power BI.
Provide technical expertise in data visualization best practices to deliver impactful dashboards.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing robust data validation and error-checking processes.
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests using Power BI and other analytical tools.
Stay updated on new Power BI features and industry trends to continually enhance reporting capabilities.



Essential

Key Requirements:


Strong experience in Power BI, including report creation, data modeling, and DAX formulas.
Solid understanding of data visualization principles and best practices.
Experience working with large datasets from various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel, APIs).
Proficiency in data cleaning and transformation techniques.
Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills to present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.



Desirable


Experience with other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik).
Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating data.
Knowledge of ETL processes or data warehousing concepts.
Background in statistical analysis or data science is a plus.



Why Hiscox?

At Hiscox, We Believe In Creating An Environment Where Our People Can Thrive - Both Professionally And Personally. Here's What We Offer


Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a 35 hours work week and a hybrid model designed for flexibility.
Holidays: 25 days + 2 Hiscox Days (Extra two Annual Leave).
Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance for you and your family, Life Insurance, a pension plan, sports allowance and access to mental health support.
Sabbatical Program: Every 5 years, take a fully paid 1-month sabbatical on top of your holidays.
Team Spirit: Be part of a collaborative and inclusive cultural with opportunities to engage in local and international initiatives



Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture
Show more

Title: Data Driven | Data Functional Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨652M. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology.

We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 18 EMEA countries. Become one of our +8.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security.

Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Devoteam is looking for a Data Functional Analyst:

Generate and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly operational reports.
Extract and manipulate data from various systems using SQL queries.
Utilize advanced Excel to organize, analyze, and present data clearly and effectively.
Perform data analysis to identify patterns, anomalies, and opportunities for operational improvement.
Support the operations team in developing metrics and KPIs.
Collaborate with different departments to ensure reporting needs are met.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data presented in reports.
Provide insights to support data-driven decision-making.


Qualifications

¬†

Solid experience with SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, charts).
Experience in data analysis or creating operational reports.
Ability to identify trends and insights from data.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.
Attention to detail and analytical thinking.

Nice to have:

Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of report automation.
Familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Turkish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities
Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.
Main Responsibilities:

- SOP Clarification and Training:
- Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
- Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
- Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
- Quality Improvement and Assurance:
- Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
- Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
- Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
- Project Management:
- Ensure timely delivery of projects
- Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
- Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
1.Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
2. 1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
3. Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
4. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
5. Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
6. Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
2. Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
3. Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Underwriting Data Analyst - Europe
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

About Hiscox

As an international specialist insurer we are far removed from the world of mass market insurance products. Instead we are selective and focus on our key areas of expertise and strength - all of which is underpinned by a culture that encourages us to challenge convention and always look for a better way of doing things.

We insure the unique and the interesting. And we search for the same when it comes to talented people. Hiscox is full of smart, reliable human beings that look out for customers and each other. We believe in doing the right thing, making good and rebuilding when things go wrong. Everyone is encouraged to think creatively, challenge the status quo and look for solutions.

Scratch beneath the surface and you will find a business that is solid, but slightly contrary. We like to do things differently and constantly seek to evolve. We might have been around for a long time (our roots go back to 1901), but we are young in many ways, ambitious and going places.

Some people might say insurance is dull, but life at Hiscox is anything but. If that sounds good to you, get in touch.

The Role

Join our European Performance Analytics team as a Data Analyst, where you'll take on a pivotal role in managing and enhancing our data processes. You'll be instrumental in driving key team projects and will serve as the primary liaison with the European Data team to address data quality issues and facilitate the migration to the Azure cloud platform.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate within a dynamic team environment while maintaining the ability to work independently.
Leverage your technical expertise in a business-facing capacity, perfect for individuals eager to gain a deep understanding of business functions.
Be responsible for the continuous improvement and evolution of the team‚Äôs data processes.
Play a significant role in the team‚Äôs transition to the Azure cloud platform.



Technical must-have


Bachelor‚Äôs / Master‚Äôs degree, ideally in Computer Science / Mathematic / Economics / Statistics (or similar)
Solid background in Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics with both an understanding of the concepts and the delivery of some projects (min. 3 years)
Previous experience in SQL
Proven experience of deriving value from data by using data analytics
Fluent in English, verbally and written



Personality traits


Motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and add value in a team
Act as a technical expert and support
Ability to link business needs to technical deliveries
Ability to work with ambiguity and change
Flexibility in both attitude and delivery style
Resilience



Nice to Have


Microsoft On-prem BI tools (SSIS and SSAS)
Microsoft Azure Data Factory (ideally working with dataflows)
Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage
Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
Databricks
Experience in the Insurance sector or Financial Services



Why Hiscox?

At Hiscox, We Believe In Creating An Environment Where Our People Can Thrive - Both Professionally And Personally. Here's What We Offer


Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a 35 hours work week and a hybrid model designed for flexibility.
Holidays: 25 days + 2 Hiscox Days (Extra two Annual Leave).
Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance for you and your family, Life Insurance, a pension plan, sports allowance and access to mental health support.
Sabbatical Program: Every 5 years, take a fully paid 1-month sabbatical on top of your holidays.
Team Spirit: Be part of a collaborative and inclusive cultural with opportunities to engage in local and international initiatives



Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

You'll be instrumental in driving key team projects and will serve as the primary liaison with the European Data team to address data quality issues and facilitate the migration to the Azure cloud platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate within a dynamic team environment while maintaining the ability to work independently.
  • Leverage your technical expertise in a business-facing capacity, perfect for individuals eager to gain a deep understanding of business functions.
  • Be responsible for the continuous improvement and evolution of the team‚Äôs data processes.
  • Play a significant role in the team‚Äôs transition to the Azure cloud platform.


Technical must-have

  • Bachelor‚Äôs / Master‚Äôs degree, ideally in Computer Science / Mathematic / Economics / Statistics (or similar)
  • Solid background in Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics with both an understanding of the concepts and the delivery of some projects (min. 3 years)
  • Previous experience in SQL
  • Proven experience of deriving value from data by using data analytics
  • Fluent in English, verbally and written


Personality traits

  • Motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and add value in a team
  • Act as a technical expert and support
  • Ability to link business needs to technical deliveries
  • Ability to work with ambiguity and change
  • Flexibility in both attitude and delivery style
  • Resilience


Nice to Have

  • Microsoft On-prem BI tools (SSIS and SSAS)
  • Microsoft Azure Data Factory (ideally working with dataflows)
  • Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage
  • Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Databricks
  • Experience in the Insurance sector or Financial Services


Why Hiscox?

At Hiscox, We Believe In Creating An Environment Where Our People Can Thrive - Both Professionally And Personally. Here's What We Offer

  • Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a 35 hours work week and a hybrid model designed for flexibility.
  • Holidays: 25 days + 2 Hiscox Days (Extra two Annual Leave).
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance for you and your family, Life Insurance, a pension plan, sports allowance and access to mental health support.
  • Sabbatical Program: Every 5 years, take a fully paid 1-month sabbatical on top of your holidays.
  • Team Spirit: Be part of a collaborative and inclusive cultural with opportunities to engage in local and international initiatives


Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Semasio (a Samba TV Company) is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Our industry-leading advertising solutions are trusted by Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI.¬†Our team is global, located in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany and Denmark. We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community.¬†Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks curiosity, then read on!

Semasio is a Unified Targeting provider that enables digital marketers to reach their target audience by seamlessly combining Audience and Contextual targeting. Our clients are leading global media agencies, brands and publishers, and we operate globally within the NAM, EMEA and APAC regions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst- Solutions to join our dynamic team. This role will play a pivotal role in ensuring the successful implementation, optimization, and ongoing support of our ad tech solutions for clients across the EMEA, APAC, and NAM regions. This position requires a strong understanding of advertising technology, exceptional data analytics skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Day to Day:
Taxonomy Development and Optimization: Create accurate, scalable taxonomies and optimize Always-On offerings across markets for performance and reach.
Client Support and Relationship Management: Serve as the primary technical support contact for EMEA clients, including media agencies, trading desks, publishers, and advertisers. Build strong client relationships and provide training on the Semantic Targeting Platform.
Partner Collaboration and Platform Optimization: Collaborate with partners to clean up, deprecate, or enhance taxonomies. Maintain and optimize internal SaaS platforms and advise on external platforms like DSPs, SSPs, and Curate.
Data and Marketing Alignment: Act as a bridge between Data and Marketing teams to promote best-in-class segments and support seasonal and Always-On targets.
Market Analysis and Strategy: Conduct competitive and trend analyses, ensuring CPM competitiveness and proposing new strategies with partners, agencies, and sales.
Technical Assurance and Custom Solutions: Maintain technical stability, troubleshoot issues with Product and Engineering teams, and develop white-labeled partner solutions.
Innovation and Differentiation: Ensure data discoverability, understand data interactions with partner algorithms, and recommend tailored solutions to optimize advertising campaigns.
Reporting and Continuous Improvement: Collaborate on reporting and analysis to drive global optimization and platform enhancements.




Preferred Exerience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Marketing, or related field
3-5 years of Technical Account, Data Analysis experience preferably in consulting and managing complex software solutions
Strong technical background with expertise in ad-serving platforms, programmatic advertising, data management platforms (DMPs), and related technologies
Experience or interest in the online marketing industry
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills and¬† ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences effectively
Team player with a hands-on mentality and drive to learn and understand new topics
Sales and relationship-building skills¬†
Have an affinity for complex technical processes and tools
Offer a hands-on mentality and have the eagerness to understand new topics
Ideally, have gained first experiences in data-driven marketing or programmatic advertising
Speak and write English fluently







Semasio (a Samba TV company) is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank‚Äôs business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company‚Äôs culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a ‚Äústart-up mindset‚Äù with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a ‚Äúbeyond banking‚Äù personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV¬¥s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EXPERIS, a Global Leader in Talent Management Solutions, is currently recruiting for the position of Data Analyst (Continuous improvement department), for Gestamp.




Gestamp is a Spanish Industrial Company, Global Leader in the design, development, and manufacturing of metal components for the Automotive Industry.




Listed on the stock exchange since 2017, Gestamp operates in 24 Countries with a workforce of over 45,000 employees. It boasts a diverse, committed, and entrepreneurial team that drives its rapid and sustainable growth.




Currently, Gestamp is establishing a new Shared Services Center for Procurement Management to serve all of Europe, in Porto (Maia). This center will be a strategic pillar for optimizing procurement operations and supplier management, improving efficienc and ensuring the quality of procurement processes with an end-to-end vision.




We are looking for a profile to develop the position of Continuous Improvement Specialist.

Their main responsibilities will involve driving process optimization and operational efficiency.




Main Information:

Proficiency in English (Mandatory)
Proficiency in other Languages (plus)
Knowledge of process automation, with a focus on improving business operations
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SAP, Excel, and Power BI
Collaborating with technical teams, particularly IT and development




The overview of the role involves identifying and proposing improvements in processes, ensuring optimal efficiency. This involves analyzing areas for improvement, designing and delivering training on tools, leading implementation tests to ensure the effectiveness of new processes and tools.




Hibrid Work Model (2 days Homeoffice/Week)




This is a new project that the company undertakes with great enthusiasm, seeking resolute, flexible, optimistic, and entrepreneurial individuals who enjoy the challenges and rewards of new beginnings. Gestamp is building the future of mobility and is looking for people to join this exciting challenge with their talent.




Are you up for the challenge?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management

Your Main Activities Are

  • Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
  • Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
  • Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Imagine your career taking you to the depths of innovation and the heights of impact. Our people enable continuous progress. Their commitment, collective expertise, and unique capabilities are the engine room behind SBM Offshore‚Äôs True. Blue. Transition. - shaping the future of energy, and beyond.

About Us:

SBM Offshore is the world‚Äôs deepwater ocean-infrastructure expert. Our work is already resulting in cleaner, more efficient energy production. True. Blue. Transition. is our promise to enable that into the future while at the same time using our expertise to support new and existing markets in the blue economy. It starts with Advancing our Core: continuing to advance the decarbonization of traditional energy production. While Pioneering More: helping to enable the energy transition and using our unique capabilities in ocean infrastructure to support more industries to grow sustainably. Sharing our experience for a better blue tomorrow.

ROLE PURPOSE

As a Business Data Analyst in Supply Chain, your primary responsibility is to support Supply Chain Management providing actionable insights, maintaining dashboards, and continuously enhancing the efficiency of our supply chain processes.

You will play a key role in analyzing existing processes, identifying gaps, maintaining dashboards, and key performance indicators (KPIs) working collaboratively with local leadership to implement improvements. Your focus will be on spotting inefficiencies and potential areas for improvement, contributing directly to the optimization of day-to-day operations and the overall success of our supply chain function.

You also play a pivotal role analyzing Supplier‚Äôs Performance, identifying low-performing vendors, supporting improvement action plans, investigating non-conformities, and engaging with internal clients to evaluate vendor effectiveness. Your insights and actions will contribute directly to elevate the quality of service and safety provided by our vendors, ensuring seamless supply chain operations.

ROLE CONTRIBUTION

Data Analysis and Maintenance:


  • Collect, analyze, and maintain data related to the supply chain, ensuring accuracy and completeness;
  • Regularly update and enhance existing dashboards to provide real-time insights into operational performance;
  • Respond promptly to data requests from supervisory teams, offering support in interpreting and utilizing data effectively.


The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:


  • High data accuracy rates and completeness, minimizing errors and improving decision-making reliability;
  • Improved real-time insights and enhanced visualization of operational performance;
  • Decrease in response time, ensuring timely support for decision-making.


KPI Development and Monitoring:


  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with organizational objectives;
  • Establish benchmarks and regularly monitor KPIs, providing real-time updates to highlight areas of success or concern;
  • Work towards continuous improvement by recommending adjustments to KPIs based on evolving business needs.


The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:


  • Consistent achievement of KPI targets and early identification of areas requiring attention;
  • Adaptation of KPIs in response to evolving business needs, resulting in improved relevance and alignment with organizational objectives.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, Data Science, Engineering or a related field;
  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a supply chain or logistics environment;
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, or similar platforms;
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail;
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills;
  • Familiarity with Data Engineering, Azure Synapse Analytics is a plus;
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Power Platform is a plus.


GENERAL INFORMATION

SBM Offshore N.V. is a listed holding company that is headquartered in Amsterdam. It holds direct and indirect interests in other companies that collectively with SBM Offshore N.V. form the SBM Offshore Group (‚Äúthe Company‚Äù). For further information, please visit our website at www.sbmoffshore.com. The companies in which SBM Offshore N.V., directly and indirectly, owns investments are separate entities.

SBM Offshore is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. SBM Offshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI)!




Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.




Responsabilities:

Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.
Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.
Performing ETL using Power Query.
Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.
Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.
Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.




Requirements:

Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.
Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.
Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.
Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.
Good level of english.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/BI‚Äù




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology? üî¥




If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge! We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation. Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions. From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business. With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.




Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.




Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) ! üê∫







What skills do you need to have?




Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.
4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.
Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.
Availability for occasional travel.
Fluency in English:
French is highly valued.







Some of your responsibilities will be:




Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.
Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.
Ensure compliance with software governance rules.
Estimate and manage data project tasks.







A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking! Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice. Red Follow Up

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out. Red Hours

Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
About Us

Planet is a leading technology company transforming payments by putting customer experience first.

We offer integrated solutions that include payment processing, VAT refunds, dynamic currency conversion, and management services for merchants in the Retail and Hospitality sectors worldwide.

In recent years, we have experienced significant growth, expanding our services and global presence.

With strong private equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we have the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisitions.

Our mission is to create a world of connected commerce where payments are simple, secure, and seamless, enabling our partners to deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Function Overview

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst - Finance, where you'll play a critical role in ensuring accurate commission payouts for a high-performing sales organization. You'll manage everything from commission calculations and reporting to troubleshooting and process improvements, all while collaborating closely with our Sales, Finance and Data teams. This role requires a blend of technical expertise in data engineering and in-depth knowledge of commission structures, ensuring accurate, efficient, and scalable solutions.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a passion for data accuracy, and enjoy identifying efficiencies, this role is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Bring your Excel skills, analytical mindset, and enthusiasm for teamwork to help us deliver exceptional results!

Administration

What you'll do


Responsible for all aspects of day-to-day commission administration resulting in accurate and timely commission payments.
Create, validate and audit monthly reports to ensure accuracy and completeness of commissions crediting and payout results.
Respond to compensation related inquiries from the Sales Team in an effective and timely manner.
Perform configuration, testing and other support activities related to plan, quota, and policy changes
Manage Sales Promotion, bonus and SPIFF payments.
Prepare key monthly commission reconciliation reports including reporting of monthly commission and sales attainment metrics.


Data Engineering And Modelling


Design and implement scalable solutions for the commission‚Äôs calculator, ensuring accurate processing of complex commission structures.
Build and maintain robust data pipelines and workflows to support real-time and batch processing of commission data.
Integrate data from multiple sources, such as Salesforce, Snowflake, and legacy systems, to ensure seamless commission calculations.
Develop and maintain data models that support the commission engine‚Äôs requirements.


Testing And Validation


Develop rigorous testing frameworks to validate the accuracy of commissions calculations.
Troubleshoot and resolve calculation and/or data errors.
Perform QA and troubleshoot discrepancies in commission results, implementing fixes as needed.
Governance and Collaboration:
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission‚Äôs calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Governance And Collaboration


Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission‚Äôs calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Who You Are


Education: University educated in Business, Accounting or related field or equivalent work experience.
Commissions: 3+ years' experience in commission processing or business/finance analyst function for a high growth sales team, preferably in the payments or financial services industry.
PowerBI: Advanced expertise in PowerBI is essential, including experience with DAX, building automated reports, and creating complex, data-driven dashboards.
SQL: Strong proficiency in SQL, with experience working with large datasets in a cloud-based environment (Snowflake).
Data Modelling: Experience with data modelling and data pipeline processes (using dbt or equivalent).
Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Azure as a plus).
ETL: Basic knowledge of ETL processes and experience working with data engineers to contribute to scalable solutions. Familiarity with GitHub for managing code and version control.
Azure: Experience with Azure cloud services.
Python (or Java): Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java for building and automating workflows.
Data Governance: Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
Excel: Advanced skills are a requirement.


Nice To Have


Commissions Software: Commission software experience is a plus (ie. Spiff, Xactly, etc.).
Certifications: certification in data engineering or analytics (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Engineer, AWS Certified Data Analytics).


Why Planet

Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you ‚Äì Apply now.

At Planet, we embrace a hybrid work model, with three days a week in the office.

Reasonable accommodations may be made in order to allow for an individual to perform the essential functions of this role successfully.

Title: Business Intelligence (Bi)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:

DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress. We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst! Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.

Responsibilities: Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.Performing ETL using Power Query.Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.Requirements: Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.Good level of English.If you're interested in this job, please send your CV to ****** with reference "CA/BI"

Thank You!

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Finance Data Operations Analyst
Description:
GuestReady is a leading short-term rental and hospitality services management company, operating in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and the UAE. Since our founding in 2016, we‚Äôve aimed to revolutionize the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a dedication to exceptional hospitality.

An excitingopportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-onapproach to their daily responsibilities of key back-officeprocesses. We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.




Key Responsibilities:

Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Based in Porto area
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
Studied advanced mathematics
Project Management skills
SQL knowledge
Comfortable navigating cloud applications
Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
Analytical, problem-solving mind
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A proactive hands-on attitude
The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage




Why You'll Love Working with Us:

üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt tick every box‚Äîif you‚Äôre a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

HTML:
GuestReady is a leading short-term rental and hospitality services management company, operating in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and the UAE. Since our founding in 2016, we‚Äôve aimed to revolutionize the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a dedication to exceptional hospitality.

An excitingopportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-onapproach to their daily responsibilities of key back-officeprocesses. We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
  • Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
  • Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
  • Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
  • Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
  • Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams


What We‚Äôre Looking For:

    • Based in Porto area
    • Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
    • Studied advanced mathematics
    • Project Management skills
    • SQL knowledge
    • Comfortable navigating cloud applications
    • Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
    • Analytical, problem-solving mind
    • Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
    • Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
    • A proactive hands-on attitude
    • The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
    • Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage


Why You'll Love Working with Us:

  • üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
  • üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
  • üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
  • üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
  • üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
  • üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
  • üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt tick every box‚Äîif you‚Äôre a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ‚Ä¶) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn an incentive of ‚Ç¨50 for passing the entrance exam by the 9th of October*
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data QA Analyst
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Experience (at least 3 years) in data testing and quality assurance (mandatory);
  • Proficiency in SQL databases (Mandatory);
  • Knowledge of automated testing tools (Selenium, Katalon);
  • Experience in Jira/Xray;
  • Fluent in English (Mandatory), French is a Plus;
  • Hybrid working regime.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at andre.b.eufrasio@aubay.pt.


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.
