Title: Risk Support Analyst - Porto or LX
Description:
Job description:

The team in Portugal is focusing on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed.




The mission of Operations team is met by:

Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
Resolution of incidents related to data availability/quality.
Regular calibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
Streamlining, running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialization




We are looking for one analyst to join our team and work on managing the support activities for Risk Systems applications. They will be expected to provide technical and functional support to Risk Systems Portugal.




Main Tasks:

Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about the quality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality of daily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required
Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Technical Skills:

Unix/Linux Systems
Shell/Python Scripting
DB modeling, architecture, and SQL
Knowledge of Java

Show more
HTML:
Job description:

The team in Portugal is focusing on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed.


The mission of Operations team is met by:

  • Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
  • Resolution of incidents related to data availability/quality.
  • Regular calibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
  • Streamlining, running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialization


We are looking for one analyst to join our team and work on managing the support activities for Risk Systems applications. They will be expected to provide technical and functional support to Risk Systems Portugal.


Main Tasks:

  • Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about the quality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality of daily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
  • Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
  • Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required
  • Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Technical Skills:

  • Unix/Linux Systems
  • Shell/Python Scripting
  • DB modeling, architecture, and SQL
  • Knowledge of Java

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Data Engineer (with BI skills)
Description:
Who is Volkswagen Financial Services?

It's been more than 70 years since Volkswagen Financial Services AG financed the first Volkswagen vehicles in Germany in 1949. A lot has changed since then, but our core goal hasn't; ensuring we meet the mobility needs of the people.

Volkswagen Financial Services today operates in 48 markets through its various subsidiaries, shareholdings, and joint ventures. Volkswagen Financial Services is the largest provider of automotive financial services worldwide.




What do we do?

The VWFS Porto is a VWFS AG IT hub, and the first outside Germany. Here we will establish a large Business & IT company of 120+ FTE. Our primary goal is to service all European markets in implementing the contract management systems and maintaining it. Our focus is on: CMS systems, satellite systems (such as document management systems, collection systems) but also integrations, data, and large project organizations.




Objectives:

The Data Management Team is responsible for ensuring that data from standard contract management systems are extracted from the source, validated and transformed according to business requirements, and inserted on International databases, BI or DWH for further processing.

You will start by joining a global BI team to develop standard solutions for the markets, specifically how data should be consolidated in different clusters/domains and design BI solutions for the customers and do the necessary analysis and reports.




About you:

At least 5 years of experience in working with data from large ERP / CMS systems.
At least 3 years of experience working with Business Intelligence and regular BI solutions such as reporting and analytics to the business.
High experience in data engineering and data interface design and concepts (SQL, PLSQL, CSharp, Phyton or other programming languages are a must, Data Modelling, Referential Data, ETL processes mandatory).
Experience in Data Analysis/ Data Quality Rules (Validation and Transformation of Data according to Business Requirements).
Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines that process large datasets.
Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g., with SQL, Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, PBI RS).
Experience with data modelling and data warehousing.
Ready to work hand in hand with international teams.
Strongly motivated and willing to bring technical expertise to the table.
Strong in English both in speaking and writing.




We believe that the right profile for this job should have / be:

University degree in IT or comparable degree preferable in the data area.
Ability to relate with customers, top management, and junior staff members in the IT department and across other departments.
Very good communication skills, high level of self-responsibility, self-initiative and the ability to interact efficiently.
Results-oriented and with team-player attitude.
Strong analytical and structural competence and ability to organize him-/herself independently.
Highly expertise on IT field concepts, procedures, and practices (ITIL, Service management, IT service management tools).
Strong drive-in to automation and improvement of processes.
Strong ability to communicate to different stakeholders from several countries.
Leading capacity and strongly motivated to build a team from scratch.
Ability to mentor junior colleagues.
Speaking & writing English fluently.
Availability for travelling.




What we Offer:

Long-term contract.
Competitive package including private health insurance, life insurance and meal allowance (pay by meal card).
Bonuses and benefits depending on performance.
Schooling allowance and pension scheme.
Incredible and unique annual company events.
Opportunity to work on an international project and be part of multicultural and multidisciplinary team.
Solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies.
Continuous training ‚Äì technical and behavioral development.

Show more

Title: Senior Data analyst
Description:
Scope




Our mission as a Corporate Digital Transformation team is to support EVS activities by improving business processes, managing corporate applications, structuring, and governing corporate data.

The modernization of our legacy data architecture into an Azure data platform, the definition of a new data governance and the reinforcement of the data team highlight our willingness to unlock the power of data and to become a fully data-driven company.

The Data Analyst‚Äôs role is to understand business requirements, collect and analyze data, and provide data products to stakeholders. He/she is responsible for supporting the utilization of Power BI and improving data quality and will work closely with various teams to ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and strategically used to enhance business performance.




Job Description




The data analyst will be part of the data team and will work under the guidance of the Data & BI Coordinator. He/She will play a key role in understanding business data usages, gathering requirements, and providing reliable datasets to data consumers.




His/her role will be to :

Collaborate with key stakeholders (Data owners, reports owners, data stewards) to understand business needs and collect data requirements.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to build prototypes of data products.
Implement data pipelines respecting development standards in Azure Synapse.
Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports.
Train and assist users in utilizing Power BI effectively.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various systems.
Ensure that all relevant technical and functional documentation is up to date.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve any issues related to data pipelines.




Profile




Qualifications :

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering in Microsoft Azure environment.
Certification PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate is a plus.




Soft skills :

Strong customers focus with the ability to manage expectations appropriately, constructively challenge requests and build a long-term relationship with key stakeholders.
Team player, autonomous and well-organized.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, minimum level : C1. French is a plus.
Positive, pragmatic, and problem-solving mindset
Good analytical skills
Focused on quality and accuracy
Will to learn and continuously evolve




Technical skills :

Must have

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Power BI
First experience with Azure Synapse and its components.
Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and lake house.
Strong knowledge of SQL and other data querying languages.




Nice to have

Microsoft D365 (Customer Engagement and Finance & Operations) knowledge is a significant asset.
Experience in working with 0365, Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps and UML diagrams/BPMN annotations will ease the onboarding.




Offer




Becoming Part of the EVS Team not only means that you will receive a competitive salary in line with your skills and the market, but also a range of other additional wellness and healthcare benefits. Our flexible schedules and hybrid way of working (homeworking) policies will help you preserve your work-life balance. EVS will give you the tools to develop your skills and your career by giving you the opportunities of internal mobilities and a wide range of trainings. We encourage our motivated talents with a friendly, lively, and inclusive environment.Check out our website if you want to know more about why you should join EVS !

  • Experience in working with 0365, Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps and UML diagrams/BPMN annotations will ease the onboarding.


Offer


Becoming Part of the EVS Team not only means that you will receive a competitive salary in line with your skills and the market, but also a range of other additional wellness and healthcare benefits. Our flexible schedules and hybrid way of working (homeworking) policies will help you preserve your work-life balance. EVS will give you the tools to develop your skills and your career by giving you the opportunities of internal mobilities and a wide range of trainings. We encourage our motivated talents with a friendly, lively, and inclusive environment.Check out our website if you want to know more about why you should join EVS !

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of professional experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Excellent experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.

3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you love transforming data into actionable insights?

At MIGSO-PCUBED, we are looking for a data-driven professional to develop dashboards, KPIs for a client in automotive sector. If you have strong Power BI skills, a keen analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate across teams, we want to hear from you! üöÄ Are you our next Data Analyst?


Your key responsibilities:

  • Develop dashboards;
  • Monitor and optimize data processing;
  • Identify opportunities to improve indicators, reports, and processes;
  • Conduct data analysis.


What you bring:

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI;
  • At least 3 years of experience in dashboard, KPI creation and monitoring;
  • Familiarity with Phyton and SQL;
  • Previous experience in banking sector;
  • Background in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Experience with statistical models;
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal stakeholders;
  • Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
  • Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.


This is an hybrid position based in Porto.


Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join our team! üî•


You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Finance Data Operations Analyst
Description:
GuestReady is a leading short-term rental and hospitality services management company, operating in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and the UAE. Since our founding in 2016, we‚Äôve aimed to revolutionize the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a dedication to exceptional hospitality.

An excitingopportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-onapproach to their daily responsibilities of key back-officeprocesses. We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.




Key Responsibilities:

Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Based in Porto area
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
Studied advanced mathematics
Project Management skills
SQL knowledge
Comfortable navigating cloud applications
Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
Analytical, problem-solving mind
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A proactive hands-on attitude
The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage




Why You'll Love Working with Us:

üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt tick every box‚Äîif you‚Äôre a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
  • Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
  • Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
  • Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
  • Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
  • Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams


What We‚Äôre Looking For:

    • Based in Porto area
    • Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
    • Studied advanced mathematics
    • Project Management skills
    • SQL knowledge
    • Comfortable navigating cloud applications
    • Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
    • Analytical, problem-solving mind
    • Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
    • Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
    • A proactive hands-on attitude
    • The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
    • Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage


Why You'll Love Working with Us:

  • üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
  • üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
  • üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
  • üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
  • üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
  • üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
  • üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt tick every box‚Äîif you‚Äôre a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

Title: Data Analyst - EMEA, Multilingual region
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Sales Support Team and drive the next phase of growth and innovation for Foundever‚Äôs Multilingual Region. As a Data Analyst, your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately. You will analyze metrics, pipeline dynamics, and trends to deliver actionable insights and strengthen our commercial proposals. By working closely with various stakeholders across the region, the analyst will bridge the gap between raw data and impactful narratives, empowering the Sales Support Team and the organization to make informed decisions. This role requires a self-starter who can navigate ambiguity, structure data effectively, and deliver actionable insights that empower the Sales Support Team and the organization at large.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‚Äé


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Availability to work from our office in Porto; Hybrid model after 3 months (40% Work from Home / 60% onsite) - mandatory.
Availability to work 40h weekly - Monday to Friday - 9am to 6pm


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Other Information

This role may require more than one interview stage and an assessment may be requested during the process.

Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (with BI skills)
Description:
Who is Volkswagen Financial Services?

It's been more than 70 years since Volkswagen Financial Services AG financed the first Volkswagen vehicles in Germany in 1949. A lot has changed since then, but our core goal hasn't; ensuring we meet the mobility needs of the people.

Volkswagen Financial Services today operates in 48 markets through its various subsidiaries, shareholdings, and joint ventures. Volkswagen Financial Services is the largest provider of automotive financial services worldwide.




What do we do?

The VWFS Porto is a VWFS AG IT hub, and the first outside Germany. Here we will establish a large Business & IT company of 120+ FTE. Our primary goal is to service all European markets in implementing the contract management systems and maintaining it. Our focus is on: CMS systems, satellite systems (such as document management systems, collection systems) but also integrations, data, and large project organizations.




Objectives:

The Data Management Team is responsible for ensuring that data from standard contract management systems are extracted from the source, validated and transformed according to business requirements, and inserted on International databases, BI or DWH for further processing.

You will start by joining a global BI team to develop standard solutions for the markets, specifically how data should be consolidated in different clusters/domains and design BI solutions for the customers and do the necessary analysis and reports.




About you:

At least 5 years of experience in working with data from large ERP / CMS systems.
At least 3 years of experience working with Business Intelligence and regular BI solutions such as reporting and analytics to the business.
High experience in data engineering and data interface design and concepts (SQL, PLSQL, CSharp, Phyton or other programming languages are a must, Data Modelling, Referential Data, ETL processes mandatory).
Experience in Data Analysis/ Data Quality Rules (Validation and Transformation of Data according to Business Requirements).
Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines that process large datasets.
Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g., with SQL, Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, PBI RS).
Experience with data modelling and data warehousing.
Ready to work hand in hand with international teams.
Strongly motivated and willing to bring technical expertise to the table.
Strong in English both in speaking and writing.




We believe that the right profile for this job should have / be:

University degree in IT or comparable degree preferable in the data area.
Ability to relate with customers, top management, and junior staff members in the IT department and across other departments.
Very good communication skills, high level of self-responsibility, self-initiative and the ability to interact efficiently.
Results-oriented and with team-player attitude.
Strong analytical and structural competence and ability to organize him-/herself independently.
Highly expertise on IT field concepts, procedures, and practices (ITIL, Service management, IT service management tools).
Strong drive-in to automation and improvement of processes.
Strong ability to communicate to different stakeholders from several countries.
Leading capacity and strongly motivated to build a team from scratch.
Ability to mentor junior colleagues.
Speaking & writing English fluently.
Availability for travelling.




What we Offer:

Long-term contract.
Competitive package including private health insurance, life insurance and meal allowance (pay by meal card).
Bonuses and benefits depending on performance.
Schooling allowance and pension scheme.
Incredible and unique annual company events.
Opportunity to work on an international project and be part of multicultural and multidisciplinary team.
Solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies.
Continuous training ‚Äì technical and behavioral development.

Title: Senior Data analyst
Description:
Scope




Our mission as a Corporate Digital Transformation team is to support EVS activities by improving business processes, managing corporate applications, structuring, and governing corporate data.

The modernization of our legacy data architecture into an Azure data platform, the definition of a new data governance and the reinforcement of the data team highlight our willingness to unlock the power of data and to become a fully data-driven company.

The Data Analyst‚Äôs role is to understand business requirements, collect and analyze data, and provide data products to stakeholders. He/she is responsible for supporting the utilization of Power BI and improving data quality and will work closely with various teams to ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and strategically used to enhance business performance.




Job Description




The data analyst will be part of the data team and will work under the guidance of the Data & BI Coordinator. He/She will play a key role in understanding business data usages, gathering requirements, and providing reliable datasets to data consumers.




His/her role will be to :

Collaborate with key stakeholders (Data owners, reports owners, data stewards) to understand business needs and collect data requirements.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to build prototypes of data products.
Implement data pipelines respecting development standards in Azure Synapse.
Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports.
Train and assist users in utilizing Power BI effectively.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various systems.
Ensure that all relevant technical and functional documentation is up to date.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve any issues related to data pipelines.




Profile




Qualifications :

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering in Microsoft Azure environment.
Certification PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate is a plus.




Soft skills :

Strong customers focus with the ability to manage expectations appropriately, constructively challenge requests and build a long-term relationship with key stakeholders.
Team player, autonomous and well-organized.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, minimum level : C1. French is a plus.
Positive, pragmatic, and problem-solving mindset
Good analytical skills
Focused on quality and accuracy
Will to learn and continuously evolve




Technical skills :

Must have

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Power BI
First experience with Azure Synapse and its components.
Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and lake house.
Strong knowledge of SQL and other data querying languages.




Nice to have

Microsoft D365 (Customer Engagement and Finance & Operations) knowledge is a significant asset.
Experience in working with 0365, Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps and UML diagrams/BPMN annotations will ease the onboarding.




Offer




Becoming Part of the EVS Team not only means that you will receive a competitive salary in line with your skills and the market, but also a range of other additional wellness and healthcare benefits. Our flexible schedules and hybrid way of working (homeworking) policies will help you preserve your work-life balance. EVS will give you the tools to develop your skills and your career by giving you the opportunities of internal mobilities and a wide range of trainings. We encourage our motivated talents with a friendly, lively, and inclusive environment.Check out our website if you want to know more about why you should join EVS !

Our mission as a Corporate Digital Transformation team is to support EVS activities by improving business processes, managing corporate applications, structuring, and governing corporate data.

The modernization of our legacy data architecture into an Azure data platform, the definition of a new data governance and the reinforcement of the data team highlight our willingness to unlock the power of data and to become a fully data-driven company.

The Data Analyst‚Äôs role is to understand business requirements, collect and analyze data, and provide data products to stakeholders. He/she is responsible for supporting the utilization of Power BI and improving data quality and will work closely with various teams to ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and strategically used to enhance business performance.


Job Description


The data analyst will be part of the data team and will work under the guidance of the Data & BI Coordinator. He/She will play a key role in understanding business data usages, gathering requirements, and providing reliable datasets to data consumers.


His/her role will be to :

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders (Data owners, reports owners, data stewards) to understand business needs and collect data requirements.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data to build prototypes of data products.
  • Implement data pipelines respecting development standards in Azure Synapse.
  • Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Train and assist users in utilizing Power BI effectively.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various systems.
  • Ensure that all relevant technical and functional documentation is up to date.
  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve any issues related to data pipelines.


Profile


Qualifications :

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering in Microsoft Azure environment.
  • Certification PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate is a plus.


Soft skills :

  • Strong customers focus with the ability to manage expectations appropriately, constructively challenge requests and build a long-term relationship with key stakeholders.
  • Team player, autonomous and well-organized.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, minimum level : C1. French is a plus.
  • Positive, pragmatic, and problem-solving mindset
  • Good analytical skills
  • Focused on quality and accuracy
  • Will to learn and continuously evolve


Technical skills :

Must have

  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Power BI
  • First experience with Azure Synapse and its components.
  • Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and lake house.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and other data querying languages.


Nice to have

  • Microsoft D365 (Customer Engagement and Finance & Operations) knowledge is a significant asset.
  • Experience in working with 0365, Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps and UML diagrams/BPMN annotations will ease the onboarding.


Offer


Becoming Part of the EVS Team not only means that you will receive a competitive salary in line with your skills and the market, but also a range of other additional wellness and healthcare benefits. Our flexible schedules and hybrid way of working (homeworking) policies will help you preserve your work-life balance. EVS will give you the tools to develop your skills and your career by giving you the opportunities of internal mobilities and a wide range of trainings. We encourage our motivated talents with a friendly, lively, and inclusive environment.Check out our website if you want to know more about why you should join EVS !

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
